poem:
**In the Shadow of the Cup**

Green plains, a globe of dream,  
tendrils of sand weave tales—  
an exchange, unseen whispers,  
a hand extends, gold glimmers.  
In the well of truths untold,  
silence buys the stage,  
at the feet of giants standing tall,  
stories sink—unheard,  
where the grass grows thick and green.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Qatari agents used bribes and threats to sink ‘terror funding’ case, UK court told Agents working for Qatar threatened witnesses and issued bribes to thwart an alleged terror funding case brought in London and to avoid derailing the Gulf state’s hosting of the 2022 Fifa World Cup, a court has heard. Eight Syrian refugees were attempting to sue Doha Bank claiming that it knowingly facilitated the transfer of funds to al-Nusra Front, a jihadist group". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Qatari agents used bribes and threats to sink ‘terror funding’ case, UK court told Agents working for Qatar threatened witnesses and issued bribes to thwart an alleged terror funding case brought in London and to avoid derailing the Gulf state’s hosting of the 2022 Fifa World Cup, a court has heard. Eight Syrian refugees were attempting to sue Doha Bank claiming that it knowingly facilitated the transfer of funds to al-Nusra Front, a jihadist group
